text: The Bow-wave Theory. This assumes that all fishing gear, when moving, sends before it a kind of scaring effect, probably through waves or vibrations in the water or along the ground. Underwater films suggest that the footrope of a trawl does this. Films have also shown plaice moving before a seine net in just the same way after being gathered inwards by the ropes. name: Scaring ground moving being by
